review: I had been looking for a budget streaming device for the family that they could pass around and share, and one that would have the WWE Network app. It was either between this or the Roku Streaming Stick.I have been using Amazon for a while now, and it was a tough decision because they both had their pros and cons. The Roku was more open and had no loyalty to certain services like the Apple TV, or the Google Nexus Player. I had seen that Roku didn't have the best customer service through reviews and I knew Amazon was always great about customer service. I've never had an issue with them, so I decided to go with them.I do not have Amazon Prime which this is perfect for those customers because it has a lot of features that pertain to it and the device is of course by Amazon.If your on the fence, I honestly recommend going for the Fire TV Stick just off the specs alone. The extra RAM, memory, and the controller.Pros:- Price ($39.99 for NEW? Roku charges that for a refurbished stick)- The remote- The Specs- The User Interface- The applications- Great for Prime members!- ASAP feature- The included HDMI extension cableCons:- No dedicated sleep or Off button.- Gets Hot while streaming (this just worries me for the "life" of this product
